meanings.def: a US, Australian or New Zealand dollar; a South African rand; an Indian rupee
examples: We're talking big bucks (= a lot of money) here.

meanings.def: a male deer, hare or rabbit (also called a buck rabbit)
a deer, whether male or female
used in some expressions to refer to the responsibility or blame for something
examples: It was my decision. The buck stops here (= nobody else can be blamed).
I was tempted to pass the buck (= make somebody else responsible).

meanings.def: if you get more, better, etc. bang for your buck, you get better value for the money you spend or the effort you put in to something

examples: Wow, you look like a million dollars.

meanings.def: to earn money quickly and easily
examples: This is a long-term project. We are not out to make a quick buck.

idioms.def: if you get more, better, etc. bang for your buck, you get better value for the money you spend or the effort you put in to something

examples: Wow, you look like a million dollars.

idioms.def: to earn money quickly and easily
examples: This is a long-term project. We are not out to make a quick buck.

meanings.def: to jump with the two back feet or all four feet off the ground
to move up and down suddenly or in a way that lacks control
examples: The boat bucked and heaved beneath them.
The shotgun bucked in his hands.
One or two companies have managed to buck the trend of the recession.
He admired her willingness to buck the system (= oppose authority or rules).
The President is unlikely to buck pressure from the public.

meanings.def: to start behaving in a more acceptable way, so that work gets done better, etc.

idioms.def: to start behaving in a more acceptable way, so that work gets done better, etc.

meanings.def: a character in popular US stories. He was a traveller in space in the 25th century and fought criminals, such as Killer Kane. His world capital was Niagra, and he was helped by Wilma Deering, Dr Huer and, from Mars, Black Barney. The Rogers character appeared first in a novel in the 1920s and was then in films, a comic strip and comic books, and on radio and television.
